repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
Also, some of the materials in this collection are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use.

Electronic records in this collection have been migrated to a library server and digital use copies can only be accessed onsite in the Rubenstein Library Reading Room. To request access, please contact Research Services before coming to use these records.
Furthermore, all or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kathy Acker Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Kathy Acker Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 1999-2002, 2012, 2014.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jennifer Scott and Laura Micham

eventgrp.event: Born.
Studied Classics at Brandeis University.
Received BA from University of California at San Diego (UCSD).
Studied at UCSD Department of Literature.
Studied at New York University Classics Department.
Published The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula.
Creative Artists' Public Services Program New York State Grant For Fiction.
Published Kathy Goes to Haiti.
Published I Dreamt I Became A Nymphomaniac: Imagining.

Published The Seven Cardinal Virtues.
Published In Memoriam to Identity.
Published Hannibal Lecteur, My Father.
Adjunct Professor, San Francisco Art Institute.
Published Portrait of an Eye: Three Novels.
Published My Mother Demonology.
Visiting Professor, UCSD.
Visiting Professor, University of California at Santa Barbara.
Visiting Professor, University of Idaho.
Published Pussy, King of the Pirates.
Died.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The papers of Kathy Acker, 1975-1996 and undated, are comprised, for the most part, of manuscript drafts of her novels, short stories, and other miscellaneous writings ranging from early works such as The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula (1975) to her last novel Pussy, King of the Pirates (1996). Described as a cyberpunk author and performance artist, Acker's novels question the strictures of female sexuality and the power of language.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The volumes of The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula were self-published and distributed by Kathy Acker. The novel was presented in six serialized parts, usually mailed to subscribers, friends, and potentially interested parties. Volumbes 1 and 3 are text sheets cut to size and mounted. Volumes 1-5 bear Ron Silliman's small ownership stamp.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula by the The Black Tarantula (published copy)
The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula #1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part one of six parts titled "Intention: I become a murderess by repeating in words the lives of other murderesses." 37 pages.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula #2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part two of six parts entitled: "A point-to-point comparison between my life and the life of Moll Catpurse, the Queen-Regent of Misrule, the Roaring Girl, the benevolent tyrant of city thieves and city murderers, the Bear Lady." 11 pages.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula #3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part three of six parts entitled: "A secret document: I move to San Francisco, I begin to copy my favorite pornography books and become the main person in each of them." 21 pages.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula #4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part four of six parts entitled: "I become Helen Seferis, and then, Alexander Trocchi." 46 pages.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula #5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part five of six parts entitled: "I explore my miserable childhood: I become William Butler Yeats." 29 pages.

did.unittitle: The Childlike Life of the Black Tarantula #6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part six of six parts, entitled: "The story of my life." 28 pages.

accessrestrict.p: A portion of the audiovisual resources in this collection have not been digitally preserved. Audiovisual resources that do not have digital preservation files associated with them require digitization prior to use. Contact Research Services for further information.

Jeff Goldberg Collection of Kathy Acker papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jeff Goldberg is a friend and collaborator of Kathy Acker. These materials consist of postcards and letters from Acker to Goldberg as well as materials related to the estate of Acker's mother, Claire W. Alexander.
